templates.name: Jack Daniels 2Q Marathon (Up to 40 miles/week)
templates.author: Jack Daniels
templates.source_reference: Table 14.3 - Two Quality Sessions Marathon Training Plan
templates.description: Two quality sessions per week with flexible easy days to accumulate mileage. VDOT-based pacing system.

prerequisites: At least 6 weeks of base running
Comfortable running 6+ days per week
Familiar with VDOT or pace-based training

program_structure.typical_week: 2 quality sessions (Q1, Q2) + easy days to reach weekly mileage
program_structure.peak_mileage_calculation: Weekly mileage = fraction of peak × chosen peak mileage

key_principles: Two quality sessions per week (Q1 and Q2)
Q1 typically Sunday or race day, Q2 typically Wednesday or Thursday
2-3 E days between Q sessions for recovery
E days accumulate weekly mileage at easy conversational pace
Strides (6-8 × 10-20 sec) on E days, especially second consecutive E day
VDOT-based pacing progresses over 18 weeks
Nonstop workouts mean immediate pace transitions
vdot_progression: Weeks 13-18: Use recent race VDOT or goal marathon VDOT
Weeks 7-12: Recent race VDOT - 1 unit
Weeks 1-6: Recent race VDOT - 2 units
Alternative: M pace from goal time, T = M - 15 sec/mile, I = T - 6 sec/400m, R = ~5K pace

E.name: Easy pace
E.description: Conversational pace, used for recovery and mileage accumulation
E.vdot_guidance: See VDOT tables or use conversational effort

T.name: Threshold/Tempo pace
T.description: Comfortably hard pace, sustainable for ~60 minutes
T.calculation: Approximately M pace - 15 seconds per mile

R.name: Repetition pace
R.description: Fastest pace for very short reps, typically 5K pace or faster
R.calculation: See VDOT tables or ~5K race pace

workout_notation.distance: Number followed by pace letter = miles (e.g., '4M' = 4 miles at marathon pace)
workout_notation.time: Number with 'min' = minutes (e.g., '3 min I' = 3 minutes at interval pace)
workout_notation.rest: Complete or walking rest between segments (e.g., '2 min rest')
workout_notation.jog_recovery: Active jog recovery (e.g., 'w/2 min jg' = with 2-minute jog recovery)
workout_notation.repetitions: Multiply symbol for repeats (e.g., '5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg)' = 5 sets)
workout_notation.continuous: Plus symbol connects continuous segments (e.g., '3E + 4M' = 3 miles easy then 4 miles marathon pace)
workout_notation.nonstop: Immediate pace transitions without breaks (athlete may add water breaks as needed)
workout_notation.steady: Maintain consistent pace throughout (e.g., 'steady E run' emphasizes consistency)

strides_guidance.placement: On E days, particularly the second consecutive E day
strides_guidance.frequency: At least 2 E days per week
strides_guidance.athlete_discretion: Optional based on feel and recovery needs

adaptation_guidelines.q_session_scheduling: Q1 on Sunday (or race day), Q2 on Wednesday or Thursday. Can rearrange to fit schedule, but maintain 2-3 E days between Q sessions.
adaptation_guidelines.e_day_flexibility: Use E days to reach weekly mileage goal. Can distribute as multiple runs per day if needed. Suggested distributions provided but athlete can adjust.
adaptation_guidelines.race_substitution: Schedule races in place of Q1 for that week. Move displaced Q1 to midweek and drop that week's Q2. Take 3 E days before race, 1 E day for each 3,000-4,000m of race distance after race.
adaptation_guidelines.missed_workouts: If too tired or overwhelmed, work with LLM to adjust intensity or volume. Experienced runners can modify based on feel.
adaptation_guidelines.taper_importance: Final week is critical preparation including carb loading. Follow daily schedule closely.
adaptation_guidelines.mileage_selection: Choose peak mileage within the range (80-100% of range maximum). Weekly mileage = fraction × chosen peak.

weekly_schedule.Q2: 5E + 2T + 2 min rest + 1E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rest between) + 2E

weekly_schedule.Q1: 2E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 30 min E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 2E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 3E + 6 × (2 min I w/2 min jg between) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 2E

weekly_schedule.Q1: 2E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 30 min E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 2E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 40 min E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg recoveries) + 2E
6E + 3 × (4 min I w/3 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 2E
8E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min recovery jg) + 3 × (2 min I w/1 min jg) + 2E

weekly_schedule.Q1: 2E + 2T + 60 min E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rest between) + 2E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 6E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 2E

weekly_schedule.notes: Race week - daily breakdown for taper and preparation

daily_schedule.workout: Q2 = 2E + 5 × (800 T w/2 min E recovery jg) + 1E

strides_guidance.placement: On E days, particularly the second consecutive E day
strides_guidance.frequency: At least 2 E days per week
strides_guidance.athlete_discretion: Optional based on feel and recovery needs

adaptation_guidelines.q_session_scheduling: Q1 on Sunday (or race day), Q2 on Wednesday or Thursday. Can rearrange to fit schedule, but maintain 2-3 E days between Q sessions.
adaptation_guidelines.e_day_flexibility: Use E days to reach weekly mileage goal. Can distribute as multiple runs per day if needed. Suggested distributions provided but athlete can adjust.
adaptation_guidelines.race_substitution: Schedule races in place of Q1 for that week. Move displaced Q1 to midweek and drop that week's Q2. Take 3 E days before race, 1 E day for each 3,000-4,000m of race distance after race.

adaptation_guidelines.taper_importance: Final week is critical preparation including carb loading. Follow daily schedule closely.
adaptation_guidelines.mileage_selection: Choose peak mileage within the range (80-100% of range maximum). Weekly mileage = fraction × chosen peak.

weekly_schedule.Q1: 2E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 30 min E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 2E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 3E + 6 × (2 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 2E

weekly_schedule.Q1: 2E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 30 min E + 2 × (1T w/1 min rests) + 2E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 40 min E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 2E
6E + 3 × (4 min I w/3 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 2E
8E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 3 × (2 min I w/1 min jg) + 2E
6E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 2E

weekly_schedule.notes: Race week - daily breakdown for taper and preparation

daily_schedule.workout: Q2 = 2E + 5 × (800 T w/2 min E recovery jg) + 1E

weekly_schedule.Q2: 6E + 6 × (2 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 4E

weekly_schedule.Q2: 70 min E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 4E
9E + 3 × (4 min I w/3 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 4E
11E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 3 × (2 min I w/1 min jg) + 4E
9E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 4E

templates.name: Jack Daniels 2Q Marathon (120+ miles/week)
templates.author: Jack Daniels
templates.source_reference: Table 14.3 - Two Quality Sessions Marathon Training Plan
templates.description: Two quality sessions per week with flexible easy days to accumulate mileage. VDOT-based pacing system.

prerequisites: At least 6 weeks of base running
Comfortable running 6+ days per week
Familiar with VDOT or pace-based training
Experienced with high mileage training

program_structure.typical_week: 2 quality sessions (Q1, Q2) + easy days to reach weekly mileage
program_structure.peak_mileage_calculation: Weekly mileage = fraction of peak × chosen peak mileage

key_principles: Two quality sessions per week (Q1 and Q2)
Q1 typically Sunday or race day, Q2 typically Wednesday or Thursday
2-3 E days between Q sessions for recovery
E days accumulate weekly mileage at easy conversational pace
Strides (6-8 × 10-20 sec) on E days, especially second consecutive E day
VDOT-based pacing progresses over 18 weeks
Nonstop workouts mean immediate pace transitions
vdot_progression: Weeks 13-18: Use recent race VDOT or goal marathon VDOT
Weeks 7-12: Recent race VDOT - 1 unit
Weeks 1-6: Recent race VDOT - 2 units
Alternative: M pace from goal time, T = M - 15 sec/mile, I = T - 6 sec/400m, R = ~5K pace

E.name: Easy pace
E.description: Conversational pace, used for recovery and mileage accumulation
E.vdot_guidance: See VDOT tables or use conversational effort

T.name: Threshold/Tempo pace
T.description: Comfortably hard pace, sustainable for ~60 minutes
T.calculation: Approximately M pace - 15 seconds per mile

R.name: Repetition pace
R.description: Fastest pace for very short reps, typically 5K pace or faster
R.calculation: See VDOT tables or ~5K race pace

workout_notation.distance: Number followed by pace letter = miles (e.g., '4M' = 4 miles at marathon pace)
workout_notation.time: Number with 'min' = minutes (e.g., '3 min I' = 3 minutes at interval pace)
workout_notation.rest: Complete or walking rest between segments (e.g., '2 min rest')
workout_notation.jog_recovery: Active jog recovery (e.g., 'w/2 min jg' = with 2-minute jog recovery)
workout_notation.repetitions: Multiply symbol for repeats (e.g., '5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg)' = 5 sets)
workout_notation.continuous: Plus symbol connects continuous segments (e.g., '3E + 4M' = 3 miles easy then 4 miles marathon pace)
workout_notation.nonstop: Immediate pace transitions without breaks (athlete may add water breaks as needed)
workout_notation.steady: Maintain consistent pace throughout (e.g., 'steady E run' emphasizes consistency)

strides_guidance.placement: On E days, particularly the second consecutive E day
strides_guidance.frequency: At least 2 E days per week
strides_guidance.athlete_discretion: Optional based on feel and recovery needs

adaptation_guidelines.q_session_scheduling: Q1 on Sunday (or race day), Q2 on Wednesday or Thursday. Can rearrange to fit schedule, but maintain 2-3 E days between Q sessions.
adaptation_guidelines.e_day_flexibility: Use E days to reach weekly mileage goal. Can distribute as multiple runs per day if needed. Suggested distributions provided but athlete can adjust.
adaptation_guidelines.race_substitution: Schedule races in place of Q1 for that week. Move displaced Q1 to midweek and drop that week's Q2. Take 3 E days before race, 1 E day for each 3,000-4,000m of race distance after race.
adaptation_guidelines.missed_workouts: If too tired or overwhelmed, work with LLM to adjust intensity or volume. Experienced runners can modify based on feel.
adaptation_guidelines.taper_importance: Final week is critical preparation including carb loading. Follow daily schedule closely.
adaptation_guidelines.mileage_selection: Choose peak mileage within the range (80-100% of range maximum). Weekly mileage = fraction × chosen peak.

weekly_schedule.Q1: 6E + 4 × (2T w/1 min rests) + 70 min E + 3 × (2T w/1 min rests) + 4E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 7E + 6 × (2 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 5E

weekly_schedule.Q1: 6E + 4 × (2T w/1 min rests) + 70 min E + 3 × (2T w/1 min rests) + 4E
weekly_schedule.Q2: 80 min E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 5E
10E + 3 × (4 min I w/3 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 5E
12E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 3 × (2 min I w/1 min jg) + 5E
10E + 5 × (3 min I w/2 min jg) + 4 × (1 min R w/2 min jg) + 5E

weekly_schedule.notes: Race week - daily breakdown for taper and preparation

daily_schedule.workout: Q2 = 5E + 6 × (800 T w/2 min E recovery jg) + 4E
